main event: A U.S. Air Force pilot reported sightings of an unidentified flying object while flying at 25,000 feet in the Atlantic Ocean on April 10, 1964.
interesting points: The object was observed for 10 minutes and appeared to have a round shape with a tail extending behind it., The object was the same color as the stars and was only distinguished by its motion., The pilot also reported seeing 7 vessels in a curving line with no outlines distinguished, only lights observed., Two unidentified aircraft with steady red lights were seen flying in loose formation and visually disappearing after a minute., Radar tracking of the aircraft continued for approximately 5 additional minutes after visual sighting.
sighted object: unidentified flying object, two unidentified aircraft, and surface vessels
witness description: U.S. Air Force pilot Capt. D. Dunlap, USMC, flying a KC 135F
